Software Developer / Software Engineer (.skills: Web application development using Java, Java EE, various frameworks (Spring, Struts, Hibernate, Eclipse, Grails, etc.)
Web application development using the .NET framework; .NET Core, C#, C++, ASP.NET, VB.NET

Front-End Developer.skills: JavaScript, jQuery, JSON, Ajax, React, Angular, Vue, Bootstrap; CSS, HTML; may also include UI / UX design

Full Stack Developer.skills: Design / develop front-end and back-end code using multiple programming languages and databases, DB management tools, MVC architecture, microservices, APIs, Agile methodology (Similar salaries paid for Python, Ruby, other hard-to-find skills)

Mobile Developer.skills: Design / develop mobile applications on iOS or Android; using Flutter, Xamarin, React Native, Ionic, Xcode, Swift, Kotlin, other tools; often includes UI / UX development

Programmer / Programmer Analyst (RPG, C.skills: Design and develop business applications on AS/400 or Mainframe

System Analyst.skills: Gather requirements, design system components; often includes coding or team leadership

Software Tester / QA Engineer / UAT Spec.skills: Automated testing, manual testing, creating test scripts, user acceptance testing

Software Quality Assurance Manager / Tes.skills: Team lead; liaise with users; coordinate with release management and version control

Cloud Technology Engineer.skills: Specialist in one or more platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud), virtualization tools (VMWare, Hyper-V)

DevOps Engineer.skills: Build / maintain systems automating software development, deployment; skills include GitHub, virtualization, scripting; coordinate with release management; troubleshoot production environments

Software Development Manager.skills: Lead one or more development teams (Programmers, Analysts, Testers, Release Managers, etc.)

Business Analyst.skills: Liaise between users and IT to translate business requirements into coherent applications

Business Process Improvement / Managemen.skills: Lean Management, Lean Six Sigma (Green Belt, Black Belt, etc.)

Web Designer / Graphic Designer.skills: Design, create, maintain website front-end using HTML, CSS3, PHP, Word Press, etc.; create graphics using Illustrator, Photoshop, Lightroom, other tools

Digital Marketing / Search Specialist.skills: Plan, research, implement SEO, SEM, PPC, AdWords, social media activities, etc.

Digital Marketing Manager.skills:
Develop social media strategy, implement campaigns, coordinate among agencies, graphic designers, search specialists, etc.
(Scope and salary vary significantly by industry and company size)

BI Developer / Data Modeler.skills: ETL tools, custom dashboard development; Cognos, SAS, Business Objects, Hyperion, QlikView, Tableau, Crystal Reports, etc.

Data Engineer / Data Analyst.skills:
Create storage sources, extract and transfer data, and improve the performance of data structures.
Tools: Python, Spark, SQL, ETL Process, Data Lake, Data Warehousing

Data Scientist.skills: ‘Big Data’ tools (Hadoop, Spark, Storm, R, etc.); develop novel business insights from large data sets

Implementation Consultant (ERP / CRM / B.skills: SAP, Oracle, Dynamics, SalesForce, SharePoint, Cognos, Business Objects, Teradata, etc.

Software Solution Architect / System Arc.skills: Evaluate, select, design overall system environment, infrastructure, application components

Helpdesk / IT Support.skills: Install, configure, troubleshoot hardware and software

System Engineer / System Administrator.skills: OS configuration and support; liaise with developers, DBAs, network engineers; relevant certifications include MCSE, MCSA, VCP, SCCM, CompTIA Server+

Network Engineer / Network Operations Ce.skills:
IT Infrastructure (LAN / WAN) support and troubleshooting, software / hardware installation and updates, often with security knowledge;
relevant certifications include CCNA, JNCIA, CompTIA Network+

Database Administrator (DBA).skills: Install, configure, monitor, tune, upgrade databases (Oracle, SQL-Server, MySQL, etc.)

Network Security Administrator.skills: With vendor-specific and/or other relevant certifications, including CISSP, Checkpoint, CompTIA Security+

Cybersecurity Specialist.skills: With vendor-specific and/or other relevant certifications, including CISSP, CISA or CISM, CRISC, ISO 27001, NIST, FFIEC

Infrastructure Manager.skills: With vendor-specific and/or other relevant certifications, including CCNP, MCSE, CompTIA Network+

Senior Infrastructure Manager / Data Cen.skills: Manages one or more data centers; may include planning, design, build-out

IT Auditor.skills: Develop / implement IT audit plans, procedures, reports; relevant certifications include CISA, COBIT, CISM

Presale Technical Consultant.skills: Network / System Engineer, Cloud / Virtualization Consultant for an IT vendor. Note that some, but not all, vendors also pay commissions for this role

Account Executive.skills: Sales (direct and through partners) of Software, Hardware, and Consulting Services

Key Account Manager.skills: Sales and direct relationship management of a vendor’s large, enterprise customers. Coordinate with presales, solution architects, consulting services; help develop RFPs

Sales Director.skills:
Responsible for all aspects of Sales, Presales, Partner Management
Responsible for country-level profit / loss; for some vendors acts as Country Manager

Project Manager / Service Delivery Manag.skills: Relevant certifications include PMP, PRINCE2, ITIL

IT Manager.skills: Salary varies significantly by industry and by size of IT department and IT infrastructure

Release Manager / Configuration Manager.skills:
Responsible for enterprise-wide version control, compatibility;
coordinate with developers, testers, users

Project Director / Program Director.skills: Responsible for large-scale, multi-faceted projects with strategic importance to an organization; includes resource allocation, budgeting, service level delivery; may sometimes be seconded to client by a vendor

IT Director / Digital Technology Directo.skills: Overall responsibility for technology selection and integration within the organization

Chief Information Officer / Chief Techno.skills: Enterprise-wide role with strategic participation at Board level; often includes regional responsibility
